item.title: Why is Garmin banned in India? Athletes tracking sports activity with these popular devices may land in jail | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Why is Garmin banned in India? Athletes tracking sports activity with these popular devices may land in jail

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: Live Mint

Garmin devices are not entirely banned in India, but certain models that feature satellite communication can lead to legal trouble for users. Recent incidents involving foreigners have highlighted the risks associated with these gadgets.

Key Points:

  • Garmin devices using satellite communication, such as the Garmin inReach, are illegal in India without permission.
  • A Scottish hiker was detained at Delhi Airport for carrying a Garmin inReach.
  • Another foreign national faced similar issues with a Garmin Edge 540 GPS device.
  • The Indian Wireless Telegraphy Act of 1933 makes the use of such devices without licensing illegal.
  • Travelers are warned not to bring satellite phones or devices to India without prior approval.
“The Garmin was illegal here and that they were handing me over to the Police.” - Scottish hiker

This highlights the importance for travelers to understand local regulations regarding technology and devices. The consequences of ignoring these laws can lead to serious legal action.

item.title: BJP releases first list for Delhi Assembly polls, ex-MP Parvesh Verma to take on Arvind Kejriwal - The Indian Express
item.description:
BJP Unveils First Candidate List for Delhi Assembly Elections 2025

Date: Saturday, Publication Source: Indian Express

The Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) has released its first list of 29 candidates for the upcoming Delhi Assembly polls set for February 2025.

  • Former MP Parvesh Verma will challenge AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal in New Delhi.
  • Former MP Ramesh Bidhuri is set to confront CM Atishi in Kalkaji.
  • Kailash Gahlot will run from Bijwasan, changing from his previous turf in Najafgarh.
  • The party dropped Anil Bajpayee from Gandhi Nagar and awarded a ticket to Arvinder Singh Lovely.
"The delay in announcing candidates was due to a lack of options on certain seats."

The BJP initially expected to release this list in late December. Meanwhile, AAP has revealed its candidates for all 70 constituencies, while Congress has named candidates for 21 seats with more to follow.

item.title: MeT warns of heavy snowfall in Kashmir, Chenab Valley from tonight - Greater Kashmir
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Tamil Nadu: 6 workers killed in explosion at Virudhunagar fireworks unit - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Explosion at Tamil Nadu Fireworks Unit Claims Lives of 6 Workers

Date: Jan 04, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

At least six workers were killed after an explosion occurred at a firecracker manufacturing unit in Tamil Nadu's Virudhunagar. The blast is suspected to have taken place during the process of mixing chemicals.

  • Explosion at a fireworks manufacturing unit in Virudhunagar, Tamil Nadu.
  • At least six workers confirmed dead.
  • The explosion occurred while mixing chemicals, flattening at least one room.
  • Fire and rescue department has reached the location.
No injuries were reported in a separate incident involving an LPG tanker that overturned in Coimbatore.

This tragic incident highlights the ongoing safety concerns related to hazardous materials in manufacturing settings.

item.title: Gas tragedy waste disposal: Police register five cases against protesters opposing incineration - The Hindu
item.description:
Gas tragedy waste disposal: Police register five cases against protesters opposing incineration

Date: January 04, 2025
Source: The Hindu

The Madhya Pradesh police have filed five cases against protesters who opposed the disposal of toxic waste linked to the Bhopal gas tragedy, leading to significant unrest in Pithampur.

  • Protests erupted after 337 tonnes of toxic waste reached the Ramky Enviro company.
  • The police enforced prohibitory orders banning public gatherings around Ramky Enviro.
  • Five separate cases were registered for public disorder.
  • Two individuals attempted self-immolation during the protests but were saved safely.
  • The Chief Minister assured public safety and adherence to judicial directives regarding waste disposal.
“The state government only transported the Union Carbide waste with safety parameters in compliance with the Supreme Court's instructions.” - Chief Minister Mohan Yadav

The situation has returned to normal, with all industrial operations functioning after the protests subsided. Authorities are awaiting further court orders regarding the disposal of the waste.

item.title: 500 On Bumble, 200 On Snapchat: Delhi Man Scams 700 Women As "US Model" - NDTV
item.description:
Delhi Man Scams Over 700 Women by Posing as US Model on Dating Apps

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Not Specified

An East Delhi man was arrested for defrauding over 700 women by posing as a US-based model on dating apps, using manipulation and blackmail for financial gain.

Key Points:

  • Tushar Singh Bisht, 23, worked as a recruiter in Noida while engaging in cybercrime at night.
  • Created fake profiles on dating apps using stolen photos of a Brazilian model.
  • Targeted primarily women aged 18-30, extorting money with manipulated intimate content.
  • Victims were threatened with the release of personal content if they refused to pay.
  • Police investigations revealed over 500 women contacted on Bumble and more than 200 on Snapchat.
  • Recovered mobile phone and incriminating evidence during the arrest.
  • At least four victims have been identified in addition to the initial complainant.
“If a victim refused his demands for money, he would threaten to upload their explicit content online or sell it on the dark web.”

The investigation highlights the growing danger of online impersonation and the need for awareness regarding online interactions and privacy.

item.title: ‘We met to eat meals’: Karnataka CM rules out change of guard as minister hosts dinner for him - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah Rules Out Change in Leadership Amid Dinner Speculations

Date: Jan 04, 2025 | Source: Hindustan Times

Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah has dismissed rumors of changes in the government's leadership following a dinner hosted by Public Works Minister Satish Jarkiholi. The gathering included about 18 to 20 ministers and was characterized as simply a meal, despite speculations of political discussions.

  • Chief Minister Siddaramaiah confirms no plans for a cabinet reshuffle.
  • The dinner was attended by 18-20 ministers and MLAs.
  • Speculation arose regarding a potential change in the Congress state presidency.
  • Opposition claims that internal conflicts within Congress may lead to governmental instability.
“What can I do if you speculate about our gathering over dinner as a meeting?” - Siddaramaiah

The dinner's implications were debated amidst suggestions of leadership struggles within the Congress party in Karnataka.

item.title: R Chidambaram, one of the architects of India’s nuclear programme, dies at 88 - The Indian Express
item.description:
R Chidambaram, one of the architects of India’s nuclear programme, dies at 88

Publication Date: Saturday morning | Source: Indian Express

Dr R Chidambaram, former head of the Atomic Energy Commission and a key figure in India’s nuclear programme, passed away at the age of 88 after a prolonged illness.

  • Chidambaram played a significant role in India's nuclear tests in 1974 and 1998.
  • He was instrumental in negotiating the civil nuclear agreement with the US, enhancing India's position in the global nuclear community.
  • He received the Padma Shri in 1975 for his contributions to science and technology.
  • Chidambaram served as the Chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission from 1993 to 2000.
  • He was appointed as the Principal Scientific Advisor to the Government after his tenure at the Atomic Energy Commission.
“He was a celebrated scientist whose contributions shaped India's nuclear policy.”

Dr R Chidambaram's legacy as a pioneering scientist will continue to influence India's technological and scientific advancements.

item.title: Nuclear scientist Dr Rajagopala Chidambaram passes away - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Eminent Nuclear Scientist Dr. Rajagopala Chidambaram Passes Away

Published: 04 January 2025, 03:48 IST

Dr. R. Chidambaram, an influential nuclear scientist known for his roles in India's Pokhran nuclear tests, has passed away after an illness.

  • Dr. Chidambaram was the Director of the Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC).
  • He served as Chairman of the Atomic Energy Commission and Secretary of the Department of Atomic Energy.
  • He was the chairman of the board of Governors of the International Atomic Energy Agency during 1994–95.
  • He played a crucial role in India's nuclear weapons program, coordinating preparations for the Pokhran-I and Pokhran-II tests.
  • Dr. Chidambaram was also a proponent of peaceful nuclear energy use, promoting India's nuclear power program.
  • He received several prestigious awards, including Padma Shri and Padma Vibhushan.

item.title: CM Devendra Fadnavis only Maharashtra minister in active mode: Supriya Sule - The Times of India
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Bengaluru to experience severe cold wave, temperatures expected to drop to 10.2°C: IMD - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Bengaluru Braces for Severe Cold Wave with Temperatures Dropping to 10.2°C

Date: Jan 04, 2025
Source: Hindustan Times

The Indian Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that Bengaluru will experience a significant drop in temperatures, potentially reaching a low of 10.2°C on Saturday. This cold wave sweeping across North India is expected to impact weather patterns in the city.

  • IMD forecasts temperatures to dip below the average January temperature of 15.8°C.
  • A warning has been issued about dense fog affecting visibility for commuters.
  • Bengaluru's lowest-ever recorded temperature is 7.8°C, occurring on January 13, 1884.
  • The coldest January temperatures in recent years were recorded at 12°C in 2012 and 12.3°C in 2019.
  • The recent drop could be the most significant since December 2011, when temperatures reached 12.8°C.
The last major temperature dip in December occurred on December 24, 2011, when the temperature dropped to 12.8°C in Bengaluru.

This cold wave is expected to continue affecting the interior regions of Karnataka over the next few days, although coastal areas may not experience significant temperature changes.

item.title: Who was Mukesh Chandrakar? Body of Bastar journalist, who covered road project corruption, found inside septic tank - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Who was Mukesh Chandrakar?

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

The body of 28-year-old journalist Mukesh Chandrakar was found in a septic tank on a contractor's property in Chhattisgarh's Bijapur after being reported missing. A murder investigation has been launched.

  • Mukesh played a crucial role in securing the release of CRPF personnel abducted by Maoists in 2021.
  • He had extensive experience, working as a stringer and managing a YouTube channel with over 159,000 subscribers.
  • His recent report on road project corruption may have led to threats against him.
  • Local authorities have launched a murder investigation with several suspects apprehended.
“The news of the murder of Bijapur's young and dedicated journalist Mukesh Chandrakar ji is very sad and heartbreaking.” - Chief Minister Vishnu Deo Sai

His death has raised concerns about the safety of journalists in Chhattisgarh, as they face threats in pursuit of accountability and transparency.

item.title: Who will pay for your tax cuts? - CNBCTV18
item.description:
Who will pay for your tax cuts?

Publication Date: December 3, 2024 Source: CNBC-TV18

India’s growth slump is squeezing its budget at a time when everyone wants a tax cut. At this stage, it’s not clear where the extra money will come from.

  • Government's revenue has slowed considerably, limiting the ability to provide tax breaks.
  • Household debt is on the rise, indicating economic pressure on individuals.
  • Growth in vehicle registrations hit a 46-month low, with rural consumption declining.
  • Finance Minister faces the challenge of balancing tax relief while controlling fiscal deficit.
"The Union Budget, due to be presented next month, must provide income support to India's poor and tax relief for the middle classes," Jairam Ramesh.

The government's ability to manage fiscal policy amid economic pressures poses a complex challenge, impacting future tax and spending decisions.

item.title: PM Modi to inaugurate Grameen Bharat Mahotsav in Delhi - Newsroompost
item.description:
PM Modi to Inaugurate Grameen Bharat Mahotsav in Delhi

Date: Saturday
Source: New Delhi

Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate Grameen Bharat Mahotsav 2025 at Bharat Mandapam in Delhi, celebrating rural India's entrepreneurial spirit and cultural heritage.

  • The Mahotsav will occur from 4 to 9 January, themed 'Building a Resilient Rural India for a Viksit Bharat 2047.'
  • It aims to enhance rural infrastructure and foster innovation in rural communities through discussions, workshops, and masterclasses.
  • Objective includes promoting economic stability and financial security among rural populations, especially in North-East India.
  • A significant focus will be on empowering rural women through entrepreneurship and utilizing technology to enhance rural livelihoods.

Additionally, PM Modi recently inaugurated 1,675 newly constructed flats for JJ cluster dwellers and virtual redevelopment projects in Delhi.

“For every Rs 25 lakh spent on the construction of a flat, eligible beneficiaries pay less than 7 per cent of the total amount.”

The Mahotsav aims for collaborative rural transformation and will showcase India’s rich cultural heritage.

item.title: NEET PG 2024 Round 3 seat allotment result releasing today at mcc.nic.in, here’s how to check - Hindustan Times
item.description:
NEET PG 2024 Round 3 Seat Allotment Result Released Today

Date: January 4, 2025

Source: Hindustan Times

The Medical Counselling Committee (MCC) is set to announce the NEET PG 2024 Round 3 seat allotment result today. Candidates who registered for this round can check their results on the MCC's official website.

Key Points:

  • The result release date is January 4, 2025.
  • Candidates can check the result at mcc.nic.in.
  • The reporting window for allotted candidates is from January 6 to January 13, 2025.
  • Verification of joined candidate data will occur from January 14 to January 15, 2025.
  • Candidate registration for this round ran from December 26, 2024, to January 1, 2025.
  • Steps to check results have been provided, including entering login details after accessing the result link.
"Candidates who have qualified in the NEET PG will be eligible for 50% All India Quota seats of Central University."

This round is part of a four-round counseling process organized by MCC for NEET PG admissions.

item.title: Maharashtra: After bitter poll fight, Devendra Fadnavis draws opposition praise - The Times of India
item.description:
CM Devendra Fadnavis only Maharashtra minister in active mode: Supriya Sule

Publication Date: N/A Source: N/A

Supriya Sule comments on the political scenario in Maharashtra, indicating that CM Devendra Fadnavis remains the only active minister from the state.

  • Supriya Sule highlights the inactivity of other ministers in Maharashtra.
  • Devendra Fadnavis is positioned as the key minister actively addressing state issues.
  • Discussion surrounding political dynamics within the Maharashtra government.
"Devendra Fadnavis is the only minister effectively engaging with pressing matters in Maharashtra."

This statement underlines the challenges faced in the state government's functioning and raises questions about ministerial performance.

item.title: Parental Consent Needed For Children To Join Social Media, Gaming Platforms : Proposal In Draft Digital... - Live Law - Indian Legal News
item.description:
Parental Consent Needed For Children To Join Social Media, Gaming Platforms : Proposal In Draft Digital Data Protection Rules

Date: January 3, 2023 | Source: Ministry of Electronics and Information Technology

The Ministry has proposed draft rules mandating that parental consent be obtained before processing the personal data of children by data-fiduciaries, including social media and gaming platforms.

  • The draft rules stem from the Digital Personal Data Protection Act 2023.
  • Data fiduciaries are required to ensure verifiable parental consent before handling children's data.
  • Specific procedures are outlined for verifying the identity of parents.
  • Rules include provisions for individuals with disabilities and specific exemptions for health and educational institutions.
  • Public comments on the draft are encouraged until February 18.
“A Data Fiduciary shall adopt appropriate technical and organisational measures to ensure that verifiable consent of the parent is obtained...”

This new regulation aims to protect children's personal data and ensure that parents have control over their children's online activities, enhancing data privacy and security.

item.title: PM Modi Launches Delhi Projects, Targets Arvind Kejriwal: 'I Don't Build Sheesh Mahal, I Build Houses' - News18
item.description:
PM Modi Launches Delhi Projects, Targets Arvind Kejriwal: 'I Don't Build Sheesh Mahal, I Build Houses'

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

Prime Minister Narendra Modi inaugurated new development projects in Delhi, including two campuses of Delhi University and various housing initiatives.

  • Inaugurated World Trade Centre at Nauroji Nagar and GPRA Type-II Quarters in Sarojini Nagar.
  • Laid the foundation stone for Veer Savarkar College in Najafgarh.
  • Handed over keys of newly constructed flats to beneficiaries under the In-Situ Slum Rehabilitation Project.
  • Criticized Arvind Kejriwal and the Aam Aadmi Party for their governance in Delhi.
“Today, India has become a symbol of political and economic stability. This role of India will strengthen even more in 2025.” - PM Modi

The projects aim to enhance living conditions and educational infrastructure in Delhi, showcasing the government's commitment to development.

item.title: Dense fog engulfs Delhi; flight operations hit at IGI airport - The Hindu
item.description:
Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations in Delhi

Published: January 04, 2025 07:34 am IST

Source: The Hindu

Delhi has experienced the longest period of zero visibility due to intense fog, halting flight operations at Indira Gandhi International Airport (IGI) for several hours.

The key points regarding the fog disruption include:

  • Record zero visibility lasting 9 hours from January 3 to January 4.
  • Fifteen flights diverted between 12:15 am and 1:30 am on January 4.
  • IndiGo and Air India reported significant delays and held operations.
  • Over 400 flights were delayed on January 3 due to adverse weather conditions.
  • CTA III compliant airplanes are less affected.
“Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information.” - Delhi International Airport Ltd (DIAL)

This weather event illustrates the challenges posed by fog to air travel, affecting hundreds of passengers and airlines over the course of several days.

item.title: Why is Garmin illegal in India? Athletes tracking sports activity with these popular devices may land in jail | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Why is Garmin illegal in India? Athletes tracking sports activity with these popular devices may land in jail

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Live Mint

Garmin devices are popular among athletes, but certain models can lead to legal trouble in India, as demonstrated by recent detentions of foreign nationals.

  • Two foreigners were detained at Indian airports for carrying Garmin devices.
  • The Scottish hiker 'Hiker Heather' warned against bringing Garmin inReach devices to India, citing her own detention experience.
  • Garmin devices without satellite communication are legal in India.
  • Devices like the Garmin inReach GPS and Garmin Edge 540 require government authorization to use due to satellite communication technologies.
  • India regulates the use of satellite communication devices under the Wireless Telegraphy Act of 1933.
“I was eventually told that the Garmin was illegal here and that they were handing me over to the Police.” - Hiker Heather

The increasing awareness of the legal restrictions on certain Garmin devices highlights the need for athletes to check regulations before traveling to India.

item.title: Weather Today: Dense fog engulfs North India for second day in row, flight operations hit at Delhi airport - The Indian Express
item.description:
Weather Today: Dense fog engulfs North India for second day in row, at least 50 flights delayed at Delhi airport

Date: January 4, 2025 | Source: Indian Express

North India experienced another day of dense fog impacting flight and train operations, particularly at Delhi’s Indira Gandhi International Airport, where at least 50 flights were delayed.

  • Dense fog reduced visibility significantly across North India.
  • Delhi airport officials issued advisories for affected travelers, urging them to check with airlines for updates.
  • Multiple airlines reported delays due to the poor visibility conditions.
  • More than 50 trains arriving in Delhi were late, with the Vande Bharat Expresses facing significant delays.
  • Intense fog is expected to continue until January 8, 2025, with possible light rain on January 6 according to IMD.
Poor visibility due to dense fog is impacting flight operations in Delhi and parts of Northern India. Please check your flight status before heading to the airport. — Air India

The weather conditions are anticipated to remain challenging, stressing the importance of travelers staying informed about their travel plans.

item.title: India protests China’s ‘new counties’ in the Hotan Prefecture that incorporates territory of Ladakh - The Hindu
item.description:
India Protests China's New Counties in Hotan Prefecture Affected Ladakh

Date: January 03, 2025

Source: The Hindu

India has lodged a solemn protest with China over the formation of two counties in the Hotan Prefecture that incorporates parts of Ladakh. The Ministry of External Affairs has asserted India's position on its sovereignty over these territories.

  • India protested against China's formation of He’an County and Hekang County in Hotan Prefecture.
  • Ministry spokesperson Randhir Jaiswal emphasized India's non-acceptance of China's territorial claims.
  • Concerns raised over a Chinese hydro project impacting the Brahmaputra river.
  • The protest comes after a significant meeting between Indian and Chinese representatives regarding border tensions.
  • The announcement of the world's largest dam by China further complicates the situation.
“Creation of new counties will neither have a bearing on India’s long-standing and consistent position regarding our sovereignty over the area nor lend legitimacy to China’s illegal and forcible occupation.” - Randhir Jaiswal

India will continue to monitor developments and take measures to protect its interests in the region as tensions remain high.

item.title: Heavy snowfall likely in Kashmir today, IMD's thunderstorms alert for Himachal Pradesh | Weather updates - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Heavy snowfall likely in Kashmir today, IMD's thunderstorms alert for Himachal Pradesh

Publication Date: January 4, 2023 | Source: Hindustan Times

The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued a warning of heavy snowfall in Jammu and Kashmir this weekend and thunderstorms in Himachal Pradesh from January 4 to 6.

  • Heavy snowfall is expected in Jammu and Kashmir on January 4 and 5.
  • Light to moderate rainfall is forecasted in the adjoining plains.
  • Thunderstorms, light rainfall, and squalls are predicted in Himachal Pradesh districts.
  • Flight operations at Srinagar airport faced disruptions due to dense fog reducing visibility.
“There is an active western disturbance which lies over the western Himalayan region,” IMD scientist Naresh Kumar stated.

This weather pattern is expected to affect visibility and travel plans significantly across affected regions.

item.title: The Hindu Morning Digest, January 4, 2024 - The Hindu
item.description:
The Hindu Morning Digest, January 4, 2024

Published: January 04, 2025 06:34 am IST

Source: The Hindu

The article discusses multiple significant events happening in India and internationally, ranging from farmers’ protests to geopolitical tensions with China and developments related to the ongoing humanitarian situation in Gaza.

  • Farmer unions claim new agricultural marketing policy is more dangerous than previous laws.
  • Mob violence in Manipur leads to police clashes.
  • India protests against China's formation of new counties in Ladakh.
  • The Union Health Ministry monitors an outbreak of HMPV in China.
  • Employees' Provident Fund Organisation completes pension rollout.
  • New York court assigns civil and criminal cases against Gautam Adani to one judge.
  • Draft data protection rules notified by the IT Ministry.
  • Protests erupt in Pithampur over Union Carbide waste.
  • MHA grants registration to NGO treating Bhopal gas leak victims.
  • Supreme Court critiques ED's treatment of former Haryana MLA.
  • French aircraft carrier group to visit Indian ports.
  • Judge sets sentencing for Donald Trump's hush money case.
  • Republican Mike Johnson re-elected as House Speaker.
  • Top European diplomats urge an inclusive transition in Syria.
  • Venezuela's government offers a reward for the opposition candidate.
  • Israeli strikes in Gaza result in multiple casualties amid stalled ceasefire talks.

item.title: Dense fog engulfs north India, flight operations at Delhi airport hit - Hindustan Times
item.description:
Dense Fog Disrupts Flight Operations at Delhi Airport

Date: Jan 04, 2025 Source: Hindustan Times

Dense fog has severely impacted flight operations at Delhi International Airport, leading to a halt in departures and arrivals. Visibility was reduced to zero, affecting not only air travel but also road traffic across Delhi and neighboring states.

  • Flight operations at Delhi airport were significantly disrupted due to dense fog.
  • IndiGo announced a temporary halt on all flights due to visibility issues.
  • Air India reported similar disruptions affecting northern India.
  • More than 400 flights were delayed as a consequence of the weather conditions.
  • The visibility at Indira Gandhi International Airport was recorded at 0 meters.
"Passengers are requested to contact the airline concerned for updated flight information. Any inconvenience caused is deeply regretted," DIAL posted.

The article highlights the significant impact of weather conditions on travel plans, with authorities advising passengers to stay informed about flight statuses.

item.title: SC Seeks Gurmeet Ram Rahim's Response On CBI Plea Challenging His Acquittal In 2002 Murder Case - News18
item.description:
SC Seeks Gurmeet Ram Rahim's Response On CBI Plea Challenging His Acquittal In 2002 Murder Case

Date: January 03, 2025 | Source: News18

The Supreme Court has issued a notice regarding a plea from the CBI contesting the acquittal of Gurmeet Ram Rahim Singh in the murder case of former Dera Sacha Sauda manager Ranjit Singh.

  • In 2021, a special CBI court convicted Ram Rahim for the murder.
  • The Punjab and Haryana High Court later acquitted him and four others.
  • The Supreme Court will also consider a related plea from the victim's family.
  • Ram Rahim is still serving sentences for other crimes.
“Ranjit Singh was murdered due to his alleged role in exposing the sect head's exploitation of women.”

This ongoing legal battle raises significant questions about justice and accountability within influential religious organizations.

item.title: SC: What steps taken to prevent bias-triggered student suicides? - The Times of India
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.

item.title: Video: Navy Officers Fall In Beach After Parachute Mix-Up In Andhra Pradesh - News18
item.description:
Navy Officers' Parachute Mix-Up Near Visakhapatnam

Date: January 03, 2025
Source: News18

Two Indian Navy officers fell into Rama Krishna beach after their parachutes got entangled during a rehearsal for an operational demonstration.

  • Incident occurred on January 3 during rehearsal for an operational demonstration at Visakhapatnam.
  • Both officers were unharmed and managed to reach the shore safely.
  • The event is scheduled to demonstrate the Eastern Naval Command's capabilities with CM N Chandrababu Naidu as the chief guest.
The Indian Navy MARCOS are fine. They did not collide; instead, the parachutes had become entangled. The rescue boats were nearby and reached the location.

The demonstration will take place on January 4, showcasing the Indian Navy's cutting-edge capabilities through various activities.
